intro: Scorzoneroides hispidula, commonly known as the hairy scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
